summary: Email correspondence between attorneys regarding victim notification procedures in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. Assistant U.S. Attorney Michael Danchuk informs defense attorney Jack Scarola that their office intends to provide notice of court proceedings to a newly added statutory victim, and Scarola confirms he will serve as the point of contact. The email also notes upcoming court dates including an arraignment and bail appeal hearing.

persons.name: Jack Scarola
persons.context: Attorney representing a victim in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, serving as the point of contact for court proceeding notifications from the prosecution.

persons.name: Michael Danchuk
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York handling the Ghislaine Maxwell case, communicating about victim notification procedures and upcoming court dates.

persons.name: Chris R. Rodgers
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence regarding victim notification in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, referenced in the subject line and context of the legal correspondence.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge who scheduled an in-person arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell on April 23, 2021.

connections.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney communicating about victim notification procedures in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Both attorneys copied on the same legal correspondence regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Assistant U.S. Attorney prosecuting the case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Arraignment
events.description: In-person arraignment scheduled before Judge Nathan at courtroom 24B, 500 Pearl Street at 2:30 p.m.

events.title: Second Circuit Bail Appeal Hearing
events.description: Remote oral argument scheduled at the Second Circuit Court of Appeals regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's bail appeal at 10 a.m., to be livestreamed.

locations: 500 Pearl Street, courtroom 24B (Southern District of New York courthouse)
keyFacts: A superseding indictment has added a new statutory victim to the Ghislaine Maxwell case, triggering Crime Victim Rights Act notification requirements.
Attorney Jack Scarola is serving as the intermediary for communication between the prosecution and a victim who is arranging a local move.
Two significant court dates are scheduled: an in-person arraignment on April 23, 2021, and a Second Circuit bail appeal hearing on April 26, 2021.
The prosecution is following proper victim notification procedures as required by law in high-profile criminal cases.
The document reveals ongoing legal proceedings and coordination between prosecution and victim representatives in the Maxwell case.
